intro: Euphorbia camagueyensis, commonly known as the Camagüey spurge, is a succulent shrub native to Cuba. It features thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are adapted to store water, typical of arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cyathium, which is a characteristic structure of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its resilience to drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
